# Examples for ATAS – Academic Text Analysis System

This folder contains real data used to test ATAS functionalities.
The corpus comes from the official transcript of the **Brazilian Chamber of Deputies**
during the **2016 Impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff**.

## 1. Input Texts

- `Texto_Limpo.txt`: cleaned transcription of the parliamentary session.
- `Video_Impeatchment_Dilma.txt`: alternative version extracted from video captions.

## 2. Output Data (Generated by ATAS)

| File | Description |
|------|--------------|
| `tabela.csv` | Bigrams extracted from text. |
| `tabela_locais.csv` | Named entities – locations. |
| `tabela_nomes.csv` | Named entities – people. |
| `tabela_organizacao.csv` | Named entities – organizations. |
| `estatistica.csv` | Text statistics: frequency, lexical diversity, entity counts. |
| `estatistica_locais.csv` | Statistics by location. |
| `estatistica_sentimento.csv` | Sentiment classification summary. |

## 3. Reproduction Instructions

Each example can be reproduced with:

```bash
# 1. Run text filtering
python src/filtro_texto.py examples/Texto_Limpo.txt

# 2. Convert to bigram table
python src/converter_tabela.py examples/Texto_Limpo.txt

# 3. Generate text statistics
python src/estatisticas_texto.py examples/Texto_Limpo.txt

# 4. Identify gender (if applicable)
python src/identificador_sexo.py examples/tabela_nomes.csv
